intro: Youngia hastiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender, hairless stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, followed by spherical seed heads that release wind-dispersed seeds. Youngia hastiformis is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
